info.title: TDEI API - v1 - POR
info.description: This is an API for publishing data to the Transportation Data Equity Initiative (TDEI) data system. This API is intended for applications producing data for and consuming data from the TDEI system. This API supports publishing of GTFS-Pathways, GTFS-Flex v2 and OpenSidewalks data to the TDEI.

get.description: Returns a json list of the versions of the TDEI API which are available.

/api/v1/osw/versions.summary: List OSW versions supported by TDEI.

200.description: Returns list of OSW versions supported by TDEI.

get.description: Lists the versions of OSW data which are supported by TDEI.

/api/v1/osw.summary: Path used to manage osw files.

parameters.name: polygon
parameters.description: A polygon (bounding box) which specifies the area to be searched. A polygon is specified by a string providing the lat/lon coordinates of the corners of the polygon. Coordinate should be specified as west, south, east, north.

parameters.name: confidence_level
parameters.description: Minimum confidence level required. Data returned will be at this confidence level or higher. Confidence level range is: 0 (very low confidence) to 100 (very high confidence).

parameters.name: osw_schema_version
parameters.description: A string with the name of the schema version the application requests.

parameters.name: tdei_record_id
parameters.description: if included, returns the metadata for the specified file, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.name: page_no
parameters.description: integer, defaults to 0

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: integer, between 20 and 100, defaults to 20

parameters.name: tdei_org_id
parameters.description: tdei organization id.

200.description: Successful response - returns an array of `osw_download` entities.

get.description:
This endpoint returns a list of url to gzip'd geojson files with osw data that meet the specified criteria. Criteria that can be specified include: bounding box, minimum confidence level and pathways version.

This endpoint can be used by an application developer to obtain a list of osw files in the TDEI system meeting the specified criteria.

202.description: Successful file creation. returns tdei_record_id of new file.

post.summary: Path used to upload/create a new osw data file.
post.description: This path allows a user to upload or create a new osw file. The caller must provide metadata about the file - includes information about how and when the data was collected and valid dates of the file. Returns the tdei_record_id of the uploaded file.

/api/v1/gtfs-pathways/versions.summary: List GTFS Pathways versions supported by TDEI.

200.description: List of GTFS Pathways versions suppored by TDEI.

get.description:
Lists the versions of GTFS pathways data which are supported by TDEI.
Returns a json list of the GTFS pathways versions supported by TDEI.

/api/v1/gtfs-pathways.summary: Path used to manage gtfs_pathways files.

parameters.name: polygon
parameters.description: A polygon (bounding box) which specifies the area to be searched. A polygon (bounding box) is specified by a string providing the lat/lon coordinates of the corners of the polygon (bounding box). Coordinate should be specified as west, south, east, north.

parameters.name: confidence_level
parameters.description: Minimum confidence level required by application. Data returned will be at this confidence level or higher. Confidence level range is: 0 (very low confidence) to 100 (very high confidence).

parameters.name: pathways_schema_version
parameters.description: version name of the pathways schema version that the application requests. list of versions can be found with /api/v1.0/gtfs_pathways path

parameters.name: date_time
parameters.description: date-time for which the caller is interested in obtaining files. all files that are valid at the specified date-time and meet the other criteria will be returned.

parameters.name: tdei_org_id
parameters.description: tdei-assigned organization id. Necessary to ensure that organization ids are unique. Represented as a UUID.

parameters.name: tdei_record_id
parameters.description: if included, returns the metadata for the specified file, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.name: page_no
parameters.description: Integer, defaults to 0.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: page size. integer, between 200 to 100, defaults to 20.

parameters.name: tdei_station_id
parameters.description: id of a station in the tdei system. gtfs station ids may not be unique

200.description: Successful response - returns an array of `gtfs_pathways_download` entities.

get.description:
This endpoint returns a json list of all gtfs pathways files stored in the TDEI system that meet the specified criteria. Criteria that can be specified include: polygon (bounding box), minimum confidence level, pathways version, date time and agency id.

This endpoint can be used by an application developer to obtain a list of gtfs pathways files in the TDEI system meeting the specified criteria. This endpoint returns a list of file-metadata including the uris of the file, which can be used to fetch the files themselves.

202.description: Successful file creation. returns tdei_record_id of new file.

post.description: This call allows a user to upload or create a new gtfs pathways file. The caller must provide metadata about the file. Required metadata includes information about how and when the data was collected and valid dates of the file. Returns the tdei_record_id of the uploaded file.

/api/v1/gtfs-flex/versions.summary: List GTFS flex versions supported by TDEI.

200.description: Returns a list of flex versions supported by TDEI.

get.description:
List GTFS flex versions supported by TDEI.

Returns a json list of the GTFS flex versions supported by TDEI.

parameters.name: tdei_record_id
parameters.description: tdei_record_id for a file, represented as a uuid

200.description: Success. Returns the file as an octet-stream.

get.description: returns a specific gtfs_flex file identified by the record_id

parameters.name: tdei_record_id
parameters.description: tdei_record_id for a file, represented as a uuid

200.description: Success. Returns the file as application/octet-stream.

get.description: returns a specific gtfs_pathways file identified by the tdei_record_id

parameters.name: tdei_record_id
parameters.description: tdei_record_id for a file, represented as a uuid

200.description: Returns the osw file - will be geojson.

get.description: returns a specific osw file identified by the record_id

/api/v1/gtfs-flex.summary: Path used to manage gtfs flex files.

parameters.name: polygon
parameters.description: A polygon (bounding box) which specifies the area to be searched. A polygon is specified by a string providing the lat/lon coordinates of the corners of the polygon. Coordinate should be specified as west, south, east, north.

parameters.name: confidence_level
parameters.description: Minimum confidence level required by application. Data returned will be at this confidence level or higher. Confidence level range is: 0 (very low confidence) to 100 (very high confidence).

parameters.name: flex_schema_version
parameters.description: version name of the flex schema version that the application requests. list of versions can be found with /api/v1.0/gtfs_flex path

parameters.name: tdei_org_id
parameters.description: tdei-assigned organization id. Necessary to ensure that organization ids are unique. Represented as a UUID.

parameters.name: date_time
parameters.description: date-time for which the caller is interested in obtaining files. all files that are valid at the specified date-time and meet the other criteria will be returned.

parameters.name: tdei_record_id
parameters.description: if included, returns the metadata for the specified file, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.name: page_no
parameters.description: Page number, defaults to 0.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Integer, between 200 to 100, defaults to 20.

parameters.name: tdei_service_id
parameters.description: Id of the flex service.

200.description: Successful response - returns an array of `gtfs_flex_download` entities.

get.summary: List flex files meeting specified criteria.
get.description:
This endpoint returns a json list of all gtfs flex files stored in the TDEI system that meet the specified criteria. Criteria that can be specified include: polygon (bounding box), minimum confidence level, flex version, date time and organization id.

This endpoint can be used by an application developer to obtain a list of gtfs flex files in the TDEI system meeting the specified criteria. This endpoint returns a list of file-metadata including the uris of the file, which can be used to fetch the files themselves.

202.description: Successful file creation. returns tdei_record_id of new file.

post.description: This call allows a user to upload or create a new gtfs flex file. The caller must provide metadata about the file. Required metadata includes information about how and when the data was collected and valid dates of the file. Returns the tdei_record_id of the uploaded file.

/api/v1/organizations.summary: Path used to retrieve the list of organizations with data in the TDEI system.

200.description: Successful response - returns an array of `organization` entities.

get.description:
Path used to retrieve the list of organizations with data in the TDEI system. Allows callers to get the tdei_org_id id for an organization.

Returns the tdei_org_id and organization information for all organizations with data in the TDEI system.

/api/v1/gtfs-pathways/stations.summary: Path used to retrieve the list of stations with data in the TDEI system.

parameters.name: tdei_org_id
parameters.description: TDEI organization id.

get.description:
Path used to retrieve the list of stations with data in the TDEI system. Allows callers to get the tdei_station_id id for a station.

Returns the tdei_station_id and station information for all stations with data in the TDEI system. 

If tdei_org_id param is specified, will return stations for that organization.

/api/v1/gtfs-flex/services.summary: Path used to retrieve the list of gtfs-flex feeds in the TDEI system.

parameters.name: tdei_org_id
parameters.description: tdei_org_id - a tdei-assigned id for an organization. org_ids can be retrieved using the path /api/v1/organizations.

get.description:
Path used to retrieve the list of GTFS Services in the TDEI system. Allows callers to get the tdei_service_id id for a service.

Returns the tdei_service_id and service name for all services in the TDEI system. 

If tdei_org_id param is used, will return services for that organization.

versions.description: A list of the versions of a data standard (GTFS-Flex, GTFS-Pathways, OSW) supported by TDEI.

station.description: Includes gtfs station information and a tdei agency id. Necessary as gtfs station id may not be unique across agencies.

tdei_station_id.description: tdei assigned station id. Necessary to ensure that station ids are unique.

station_name.description: typically the station_name used in GTFS files

polygon.description: A polygon that defines the area of the station.

gtfs_flex_upload.title: Root Type for gtfs_flex
gtfs_flex_upload.description: represents a gtfs_flex data file. same as in consumer api,

collected_by.description: Description of who data was collected by. See Best Practices document for information on how to format this string.

collection_date.description: Date-time that data was collected. If uploader includes time, time should be specified in UTC time. If uploader does not include time, time will be registered as 12:01am UTC time on the date specified.

collection_method.description: Method by which the data was collected. See Best Practices document for information on how to format this string.

valid_from.description: date from which this file is valid

valid_to.description: date until which this data is valid

data_source.description: Description of data source or sources from which the data was collected. See Best Practices document for information on how to format this string.

polygon.description: Optional polygon that indicates the boundaries of data included in this file.

flex_schema_version.description: version of gtfs flex schema this file conforms to

tdei_org_id.description: tdei-assigned organization id. Represented as UUID. Organization ids can be retrieved using the /api/v1.0/organizations path.

tdei_service_id.description: TDEI id of a GTFS Flex service

gtfs_pathways_upload.title: Root Type for gtfs_flex
gtfs_pathways_upload.description: represents a gtfs_flex data file. same as in consumer api,

collected_by.description: Description of who data was collected by. See Best Practices document for information on how to format this string.

collection_date.description: Date-time that data was collected. If uploader includes time, time should be specified in UTC time. If uploader does not include time, time will be registered as 12:01am UTC time on the date specified.

collection_method.description: Method by which the data was collected. See Best Practices document for information on how to format this string.

valid_from.description: date from which this file is valid

valid_to.description: date until which this data is valid

data_source.description: Description of data source or sources from which the data was collected. See Best Practices document for information on how to format this string.

tdei_station_id.description: tdei-assigned station id. Represented as UUID. Station ids can be retrieved using the /api/v1.0/stations path.

pathways_schema_version.description: version of gtfs pathways schema this file conforms to

tdei_org_id.description: tdei-assigned organization id. Represented as UUID. Organization ids can be retrieved using the /api/v1.0/organizations path.

osw_upload.title: Root Type for gtfs_flex
osw_upload.description: represents a gtfs_flex data file. same as in consumer api,

collected_by.description: Description of who data was collected by. See Best Practices document for information on how to format this string.

collection_date.description: Date-time that data was collected. If uploader includes time, time should be specified in UTC time. If uploader does not include time, time will be registered as 12:01am UTC time on the date specified.

collection_method.description: Method by which the data was collected. See Best Practices document for information on how to format this string.

valid_from.description: date from which this file is valid

valid_to.description: date until which this data is valid

data_source.description: Description of data source or sources from which the data was collected. See Best Practices document for information on how to format this string.

polygon.description: Polygon that indicates the boundaries of data included in this file.

osw_schema_version.description: version of gtfs flex schema this file conforms to

tdei_org_id.description: id of the organization which this file is for.

versionSpec.title: Root Type for versionSpec
versionSpec.description: Specification for a data standards (GTFS-Flex, GTFS-Pathways, OSW) versions.

specification.description: link to the specification for the data standard

total_pages.description: total number of pages in the response

current_page.description: the start page of the current response

total_items.description: The total number of items in this response.

num_pages.description: the number of pages provided in this response.

gtfs_flex_download_md.title: Root Type for gtfs_flex
gtfs_flex_download_md.description: represents a gtfs_flex data file. same as in consumer api,

collected_by.description: Description of who data was collected by. See Best Practices document for information on how to format this string.

collection_method.description: Method by which the data was collected. See Best Practices document for information on how to format this string.

valid_from.description: date from which this file is valid

valid_to.description: date until which this data is valid

confidence_level.description: tdei-generated confidence level. Confidence level range is: 0 (very low confidence) to 100 (very high confidence).

data_source.description: Description of data source or sources from which the data was collected. See Best Practices document for information on how to format this string.

polygon.description: Polygon that indicates the boundaries of data included in this file.

tdei_record_id.description: unique id identifying the file in the tdei system, can be used to retrieve the file itself.

flex_schema_version.description: version of gtfs flex schema this file conforms to

download_url.description: The url from which this file can be downloaded.

tdei_org_id.description: tdei-assigned organization id. Represented as UUID. Organization ids can be retrieved using the /api/v1.0/organizations path.

tdei_service_id.description: the id of the data service being downloaded from

gtfs_flex_download.description: information included when providing a list of gtfs flex files.

gtfs_pathways_download_md.title: Root Type for gtfs_flex
gtfs_pathways_download_md.description: represents a gtfs_flex data file. same as in consumer api,

collected_by.description: Description of who data was collected by. See Best Practices document for information on how to format this string.

collection_method.description: Method by which the data was collected. See Best Practices document for information on how to format this string.

valid_from.description: date from which this file is valid

valid_to.description: date until which this data is valid

confidence_level.description: tdei-generated confidence level. Confidence level range is: 0 (very low confidence) to 100 (very high confidence).

data_source.description: Description of data source or sources from which the data was collected. See Best Practices document for information on how to format this string.

tdei_station_id.description: tdei-assigned station id. Represented as UUID. Station ids can be retrieved using the /api/v1.0/stations path.

tdei_record_id.description: unique id identifying the file in the tdei system, can be used to retrieve the file itself.

pathways_schema_version.description: version of gtfs pathways schema this file conforms to

download_url.description: The url from which this file can be downloaded.

tdei_org_id.description: tdei-assigned organization id. Represented as UUID. Organization ids can be retrieved using the /api/v1.0/organizations path.

gtfs_pathways_download_md.example:
{
    "collected_by": "See best practices document",
    "collection_date": "2018-02-10T09:30Z",
    "collection_method": "See best practices document",
    "confidence_level": 41,
    "data_source": "See best practices document",
    "download_url": "/api/v1/gtfs-pathways/{tdei_record_id}",
    "pathways_schema_version": "v1.1",
    "tdei_org_id": "5cfdf0f1-902b-4e2d-9297-b979b2d5d905",
    "tdei_station_id": "29dd4f2e-981a-46dc-b00d-0dc1937b2e53",
    "valid_from": "2018-02-10T09:30Z",
    "valid_to": "2018-02-10T09:30Z",
    "tdei_record_id": "4e991e7a-5c16-4ebf-ad31-3a3625bcca10",
}

gtfs_pathways_download.description: information to be provided along with a list of pathways files

osw_download_md.title: Root Type for gtfs_flex
osw_download_md.description: represents a gtfs_flex data file. same as in consumer api,

collected_by.description: Description of who data was collected by. See Best Practices document for information on how to format this string.

collection_method.description: Method by which the data was collected. See Best Practices document for information on how to format this string.

valid_from.description: date from which this file is valid

valid_to.description: date until which this data is valid

data_source.description: Description of data source or sources from which the data was collected. See Best Practices document for information on how to format this string.

polygon.description: Polygon that indicates the boundaries of data included in this file.

confidence_level.description: tdei-generated confidence level. Confidence level range is: 0 (very low confidence) to 100 (very high confidence).

tdei_record_id.description: unique id identifying the file in the tdei system, can be used to retrieve the file itself.

osw_schema_version.description: version of gtfs flex schema this file conforms to

download_url.description: The url from which this file can be downloaded.

tdei_org_id.description: id of the organization with which this file is associated

osw_download.description: information provided with a list of osw files to be downloaded

organization.description: Includes gtfs agency information and a tdei agency id. Necessary as gtfs agency id may not be unique across agencies.

org_name.description: Organization name. For transit agencies, typically the agency name used in GTFS releases.

tdei_org_id.description: tdei-assigned organization id. Necessary to ensure that organization ids are unique. Represented as a UUID.

polygon.description: Polygon that defines the service area of the organization.

description.description: A one-sentence description of this organization.

example.description: King County Metro provides transit services to King County, WA

service.description: Includes name and tdei id of a gtfs flex service.

tdei_service_id.description: tdei assigned service id. Necessary to ensure that service ids are unique.

polygon.description: A polygon that defines the service area for this service.

Unauthorized.description: This request is unauthorized. The API key or Authorization token provided is not valid.

PathwaysFileNotFound.description: A GTFS pathways file that matches the specified parameters (combination of agencyid, stationid, confidence level, and version) was not found.

FlexFileNotFound.description: A GTFS flex file that matches the specified parameters (combination of agencyid, confidence level, and version) was not found.

FileIdNotFound.description: A file with the specified id was not found. Use the /tdei_consumer/v1.0/gtfs_pathways or /tdei_consumer/v1.0/gtfs_flex endpoints to find valid file ids.

OSWNotFound.description: OSW data meeting the specifications (version and bounding box) was not found.Data is expected to be available for King and Snohomish counties in Washington, Multnomah and Columbia counties in Oregon, and Baltimore and Harford counties in Maryland.

InvalidRequest.description: The request was invalid. For example, the meta-data may not be valid.

ApplicationId.description: Application Id required by all applications that use the TDEI Consumer API.
ApplicationId.name: appID
